intro: Galarhoeus tibeticus, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Galarhoeus tibeticus is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
